content.p: Research is one of the defining activities of the Institute of Work, Organisation and Wellbeing. There is a close and mutually beneficial relationship between the division's research and postgraduate teaching as each contributes to the other. Our research is in applied psychology and grounded in real world issues. This research contributes directly or indirectly to the promotion of 'healthy people, healthy organisations and healthy communities'. The division's teaching and research activities are managed through three clusters outlined below: The Occupational Health and Well-being Cluster is concerned with contemporary issues in occupational health and well-being with emphasis on cross-cultural contexts.
